page.title: 19RELIGION IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content: The only place of worship is St. Botolph's, Stow Longa,which dates from the 13th Century. The church stands among trees on the edge of the village, its secluded position belying the fact that the tower was once the highest point in the old County of Huntingdonshire. St.Botolph's shares a priest with six other parishes in Leightonstone Deanery, in the diocese of Ely, but, nevertheless, a service is held at 11 o'clock each Sunday. Whatever their religious faith, or lack of it, the villagers are proud of their church, and money-raising events, such as the annual gymkhana in aid of the restoration fund, play an important part in village life. Stow Longa also falls within the boundary of the Roman Catholic parish of Buckden, where two families regularly attend Mass.
